Two polished reveal.js presentation themes with shared layout architecture — slide types, emphasis classes, callouts, font utilities, styled tables, and citation support from a single install.

## Install

```bash
quarto add Data-Wise/dtslides
```

Installs both themes under `_extensions/`. Requires Quarto >= 1.6.0. See [Getting Started](getting-started.qmd) for usage and customization.

## Features

```{=html}
<div class="feature-grid">
  <div class="feature-item">
    <h3>Slide Types</h3>
    <p><code>.small-slide</code> <code>.tiny-slide</code> <code>.quote-slide</code> <code>.image-slide</code> <code>.section-slide</code> <code>.slide-code</code> <code>.scrollable</code></p>
  </div>
  <div class="feature-item">
    <h3>Emphasis &amp; Highlighting</h3>
    <p><code>.alert</code> <code>.fg</code> <code>.bg</code> <code>.highlight</code> <code>.note</code> <code>.warning</code> — inline spans for drawing attention to key content.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="feature-item">
    <h3>Custom Callouts</h3>
    <p><code>.callout-example</code> <code>.callout-question</code> <code>.callout-insight</code> plus all standard Quarto callouts, styled to match each theme.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="feature-item">
    <h3>Font Sizing</h3>
    <p><code>.largest</code> through <code>.smallest</code> — apply to slides or divs. Code blocks inside scale proportionally.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="feature-item">
    <h3>Layout Utilities</h3>
    <p>Text alignment (<code>.left</code> <code>.center</code> <code>.right</code>), vertical positioning (<code>.v-center</code> <code>.v-top</code> <code>.v-bottom</code>), buttons, badges.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="feature-item">
    <h3>Citations &amp; References</h3>
    <p>Pandoc citeproc citations styled at <code>0.8em</code>. Reference lists auto-shrink at 6+ and 11+ entries — no JavaScript needed.</p>
  </div>
</div>
```

See the full [CSS Class Reference](reference.qmd) for usage examples.

## Quick Example

A minimal slide using dtslides features:

````markdown
## Key Findings {.small-slide}

The treatment effect was [statistically significant]{.alert}
with [p < 0.001]{.highlight}.

::: {.callout-insight}
Effect size doubled when controlling for baseline severity.
:::

[[See Methods]{.button}](#methods)
````

This renders a compact slide with alert text, a highlighted p-value, a themed callout box, and a navigation button — all without writing any CSS.
